Description: Faience deep bowl with flaring lip. Mould-made decoration of a palm calyx.
Curator's comments: Found unregistered, but with other objects from Naukratis with labels from the EEF from Petrie's excavations at Naukratis in 1885. Parallels dated to the 3rd to the 1st century BC (Nenna and Seif el-Din, 2000, Form T2.1; Nenna 2013, Fig. 6.1, T2.1). Nenna, M.-D. 2013. Faience vessels and objects in Nicholson, P. T. (ed.) Working in Memphis: The production of faience at Roman period Kom Helul. London: Egypt Exploration Society: 106-132. Nenna, M.-D. and M. Seif el-Din. La vaisselle en faïece d’époque gréco- romaine. Études Alexandrines 4. Cairo: IFAO.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FC.15)
